title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Jurors in Sarah Palin's defamation suit against the New York Times learned while deliberating that the judge planned to reject her claims. How'd they find out?

A. One of them was a psychic.

B. Some got push notifications on their phones.

C. They heard it on NPR during a lunch break.

D. A bailiff let it slip.

---

2. Charlie Munger said he thinks the world of somebody, "but I'm not sure I want him to be my emperor." Who's he talking about?

A. Hirohito

B. Larry Fink

C. Jeff Bezos

D. Justin Trudeau

---

3. The mascot -- or at least the mascot costume -- of a collegiate baseball team was returned two weeks after it went missing in a piece of lost luggage. Which mascot?

A. Dillon The Pickle

B. Penny The Quaker

C. Meyer The Crier

D. Alan The Aardvark

---

4. Which state, after adopting the nation's lowest blood-alcohol limit for drivers, saw auto fatalities drop sharply?

A. Vermont

B. New Mexico

C. California

D. Utah

---

5. Which of these was a key clue in leading authorities to a couple accused of stealing a sum of Bitcoin now worth $4.5 billion?

A. Bitcoin dust in a pants cuff

B. A $500 Walmart gift card

C. A candlestick

D. A dead aspidistra

---

6. Former Attorney General Loretta Lynch has a new law client. Who is it?

A. The NFL (facing a suit by Brian Flores)

B. Steve Bannon (facing contempt charges)

C. Planned Parenthood (battling Texas abortion law)

D. Students for Fair Admissions (suing Harvard)

---

7. France said it will withdraw its forces from Mali but keep them in which two countries?

A. Gambia and Guinea Bissau

B. Ivory Coast and Guinea

C. Burkina Faso and Niger

D. Mauritania and Senegal

---

8. Who became the world's biggest exporter of liquid natural gas for the first time last December?

A. China

B. Russia

C. Nigeria

D. The U.S.

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. B

3. A

4. D

5. B

6. A

7. C

8. D
